programme.sub-title: Leicester City v West Ham United.
programme.desc: Leicester City v West Ham United (Kick-off 1.30pm). Coverage of the Premier League match from King Power Stadium, as the hosts continue their quest for the title. The Foxes entered the final six matches of the season knowing that four wins would see them crowned as champions, and Claudio Ranieri's men will be keen to claim them as soon as possible given they have what looks like a difficult run-in on paper. Today they face the Hammers, who still have much to play for as they aim to secure a place in the top four, and so know they need to finish with a string of victories themselves.(n)

programme.title: Live Ford Monday Night Football
programme.desc: Stoke City v Tottenham Hotspur (Kick-off 8.00pm). Coverage of the Premier League match from Britannia Stadium, where Spurs know that anything other than a victory will seriously hinder their title prospects. While a recent draw at Anfield saw them fall seven points behind Leicester City, the north London outfit will look to finish strongly and secure a place in next season's Champions League, even if the title slips beyond their grasp. Stoke have European qualification ambitions of their own, and will be eager for victory as they attempt to earn a place in the Europa League.(n)

programme.title: Atalanta - Roma 17/04
programme.desc: Cod. 493200. Serie A. 33a giornata. Collegamento ore 12:00 con Prepartita. Bergamaschi a quota 35 punti, +5 rispetto alla scorsa stagione e +8 sulla terzultima. Perfetto equilibrio nei 54 precedenti a Bergamo di serie A contro la Roma, con 18 vittorie a testa e 18 pari.
